results.title: A Score for women's voices
results.creator_credit: Sophie Bissonnette, Marcel Simard, Monique Simard, National Film Board of Canada and Productions Virage
results.brief_description: An amazing documentary recording the historic World March of Women between March and October 2000. Initiated by the Quebec Federation of Women, this march was a global protest against poverty and violence towards women, uniting women from all cultures, religions, ethnic and socio-economic backgrounds in a common goal - to change the world. Director Sophie Bissonnette, with the collaboration of Anne Laure Folly (Senegal), Pat Fiske and Nicolette Freeman (Australia), Deepa Chanraj (India), Carmen Guarini (Ecuador) and Helene Klodawsky (USA), covered the march. However, the filmmakers were invited by Bissonnette to film a special project occurring in their own country. In Senegal a community battles female genital mutilation through education; in Australia a women’s circus teaches survivors of sexual assault to become skilled performers; in India a group of low-caste women mediate domestic disputes in informal women’s courts; in Ecuador native women offer leadership training programs to create women leaders; and in the United States, Linda Carney explains Survival Inc. for the poor and homeless women in Boston. The film follows the journey of the march through Mozambique, Senegal, Belgium, Japan, Morocco, Australia, Lebanon, Canada, Mexico, Croatia, India, Colombia, Ecuador, Brazil, the Philippines and the United States capturing the spirit of the women, their music and songs of protest, their cry for peace and civil rights and for some a chance to relate their own personal stories. Contains some b&w images.

results.title: A Salute to Friz Freleng
results.creator_credit: Isadore Freleng and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Born Isadore Freleng in 1906 in Missouri (died 1995) but better known as Friz Freleng, this Academy Award winner cartoonist/animator joined Warner Bros studios as head animator in 1930 and it is here that he created the majority of his over 300 cartoons, mainly for Merrie Melodies and Looney Tunes. His brand of humour and whacky cartoon characters are loved and adored world-wide and across all age groups. This video pays tribute to Freleng by showing eight of his more prominent and well-known cartoons mainly from the 1950s period and include those evergreen favourites Sylvester and Tweety, Bugs Bunny, Yosemite Sam, and Speedy Gonzales. Three of the eight cartoons shown are Oscar winners: “Birds anonymous”, “Speedy Gonzales” and “Knighty knight Bugs”.

results.title: A Research brief. No. 3
results.creator_credit: John McAulay, Dumont Film Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film records projects undertaken by the National Research Council of Canada - the launching of helium balloons to measure the ozone layer, cloud seeding to help fight forest fires, a study of the Gaspe current, recommendations to alleviate the St. Laurence Seaway Bottleneck, helicopter transport of trees out of logging sites and the feasibility of rockets to carry scientific instruments into the heart of the aurora borealis.

results.title: A Sailor is born
results.creator_credit: Jim Mellor and Editorial Film Productions
results.brief_description: Follows the career of a typical Royal Navy recruit and thereby illustrates the scope and thoroughness of the training methods of the Navy.

results.title: A Queen is crowned
results.brief_description: A comprehensive account of the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II, showing the ceremonies within Westminster Abbey, followed by the return procession to Buckingham Palace.

results.title: A Pot of message
results.brief_description: Argues that Australians eat and drink too much and do not exercise enough. Because much of modern food is highly refined it lacks basic nutrition. Although there is a growing awareness of the need to eat more natural food it must be remembered that health foods and vitamin pills are not really the answer.

results.title: A Portrait of Bishhop Carlos Ximenes Belo
results.creator_credit: Max Stahl, Gillan Films and Intervision
results.brief_description: This program documents the impact of the Indonesian invasion of East Timor. It particularly focuses on the role of Bishop Carlos Ximenes Belo. He believes that he should be outspoken about the atrocities suffered by the people of East Timor because of the Indonesian occupation. The format consists of film footage depicting life in East Timor: a commentary and interviews with Bishop Belo, the Indonesian General Herman Mantiri and East Timorese people.

results.title: A Scream from silence = Mourir a tue-tete
results.creator_credit: Anne-Claire Poirier, Jacques Gagne and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This feature film documents the rape and eventual suicide of Suzanne, a nurse whose physical and emotional health deteriorates beyond repair as a result of the violence inflicted on her. Images of ritual and mass rape reinforce the horror of this act of domination. In this docudrama drawn from case histories, the filmmaker explores social attitudes that cause women to feel guilty for being raped. It touches upon the physical, emotional, spiritual and legal aspects of this crime. Cast includes Luce Guillbeault, Germaine Houde, Michele Mercure. (Awards: Chicago; Houston.)

results.title: A Pornographic affair = Une Liaison pornographique [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Frederic Fonteyne, Claude Waringo, Patrick Quinet, Rolf Schmid, ARP, Artemis Productions, Canal+, Fama Film, Le Production Lazemec, Radio Television Belge Francophone (RTBF) and Samsa Film
results.brief_description: Two strangers, played by Nathalie Baye and Sergi Lopez, meet through a personal ad in a pornographic magazine. They are both interested in exploring a sexual fantasy that for a variety of reasons they feel shy of disclosing with regular partners. Filmed in flashback, while the two characters are interviewed straight to the camera, this erotic and intelligent film explores how men and women are navigating the fraught arena of sexual desire in a post-feminist and post-macho culture. Both Baye and Lopez deliver charming and realistic performances in which they present the ambiguities and contradictions of modern urban life: on one hand proud and happy with their independence; on the other aching for the comfort and solidity of dependency. In the end, the sexual fantasy which begins this pornographic affair, does not matter: it is up to the viewer to interpret the relationship through the nature of our own desires and fantasies. Beyond sex, desire and fantasy, “A Pornographic Affair” argues that what matters is our ability to communicate and to be open to being touched by another human being. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: A Scenic harvest from the kingdom of pain
results.creator_credit: Joe Rees, Jonathan Reiss, IKON (GB) and Target Video
results.brief_description: Follows the performance art group Survival Research Laboratories and records three performances of the group. The setting up for a performance is shown, and interviews with some of the members of the group are conducted. The video also reports on whether injuries by the audience or performers were sustained.
